properties.id: The ID of the notification provider.
properties.handle: The handle of the notification provider
properties.name: The name of the notification provider
properties.is_enabled: Whether the notification provider is enabled.
properties.channels: The channels the notification provider can be used for. For example, `email`.

properties.channel: The channel of the notification. For example, `email`.
properties.template: The template of the notification. For example, if you're using a service like SendGrid, this would be the template ID of the notification.
properties.data: The data payload sent with the notification
properties.trigger_type: The event name, the workflow, or anything else that can help to identify what triggered the notification.
properties.resource_id: The ID of the resource this notification is for, if applicable.
properties.resource_type: The type of the resource this notification is for, if applicable. For example, `order`.
properties.receiver_id: The ID of the customer this notification is for, if applicable.
properties.original_notification_id: The ID of the original notification, in case this is a retried notification.
properties.idempotency_key: The idempotency key of the notification.
properties.external_id: The id of the notification in the external system.
properties.provider:
The associated provider used to send the notification.

@expandable
